text: Narmada Pushkaram is a festival of River Narmada normally occurs once in 12 years. This Pushkaram is observed for a period of 12 days from the time of entry of Jupiter into Vrushabha Rasi (Taurus). Amarkantak temple, Omkareshawar Temple, Chausath Yogini Temple, Chaubis Avatar Temple, Maheshwar Maheshwar Temple, Nemawar Siddheshwar Mandir and Bhojpur Shiva Temple are very ancient and famous. Omkareshawar is one of the twelve Jyothirlingas and Amrarkantak are the best places to take holy bath in the Naramada river. == See also == *Kumbh Mela *Godavari Pushkaralu *Pushkaram ==References== Category:Religious festivals in India Category:Water and Hinduism Category:Hindu festivals Category:Religious tourism in India Category:Hindu pilgrimages Category:Narmada River
title: Narmada Pushkaram
